Description: FL >= 50 %, SI + MO < 13% and NO < 50 %
Provision Uses: Milk, Production of offspring for slaughter as young animals
Regulation and Maintenance Uses: Fertilizer, Habitat provision and biodiversity, Land degradation and erosion prevention, Vegetation management, Waste recycling of non-human edible feed, Weed control and biomass residue management

Description: Up until 2021 the numbers document the population of Grauvieh and Rätisches Grauvieh. As of 2022 only the Rätisches Grauvieh breed is considered as Swiss breed. Grauvieh numbers are therefore no longer included.
Provision Uses: Horns, Meat, Milk, Production of offspring for slaughter as young animals
Regulation and Maintenance Uses: Fertilizer, Habitat provision and biodiversity, Land degradation and erosion prevention, Vegetation management, Waste recycling of non-human edible feed, Weed control and biomass residue management
Cultural Uses: Fancy, Hobby, Tourist attraction / touristic potential
Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is well adapted to mountainous environments..
Special characteristic of product: This breed produces a high quality meat (finefibre) and the high proportion of valuable meat parts is remarkable.
Other special qualities: This breed has strong legs
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: adapted to mountains and poor grassland
Color comments: uni coloured: grey
Description of origin: composite of diverse Grison mountain cattle strains; displaced by crossing with Swiss Brown; reimported from Austria in 1985;
Comments management conditions: Alped in summer, housed only during winter (about 5 months). Feeding: gras and hey
Additional performance parameters: Milk protein (%): ca. 3.2

Description: This breed was called Simmental Fleckvieh before 2009
Provision Uses: Meat, Milk, Production of offspring for slaughter as young animals
Regulation and Maintenance Uses: Fertilizer, Habitat provision and biodiversity, Land degradation and erosion prevention, Vegetation management, Waste recycling of non-human edible feed, Weed control and biomass residue management
Efabis cultural role comment: the breed is originated from Switzerland
Color comments: multi coloured: red and yellow pied with white head
Description of origin: composite of Saanen, Frutigen, Freiburger and local landrace breeds
Import: since 1967, ~20% from Red Holstein (Canada/USA), <5% Montbeliard (France), since 1975, <5% from Red Friesian (Netherlands) and from Red Holstein (Germany)
Comments management conditions: The animals are partly kept under mountainous conditions.

Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is adapted to highland conditions in altitudes above 3 500 m asl.
Other specific visible traits: Creole type

Description of origin: non-nondescript of Criollo origin with Shorthorn, Friesian and Normande blood
Locally adapted exotic dairy breed; Holstein * Overo negro or Overo colorado.

imported from Germany and The Netherlands; exotic; 1970-1973 CORFO made massive imports, to distribute them to interested producers, universities and research centers, especially in the South of the country.

Description Of Specific Uses: The main use of Overo negro cattle is milk production in extensive systems with supplementation during critical seasons. Milk is mainly delivery to big factories to produce milk (fluid and powder) and dairy foods including cheese. In addition, a small percentage of the production is produced by little farmers who also deliver the milk to big industry or autoconsumption, and/or producing cheese in a lower scale. Also, dairy males are used to meat production.

Adaptability to specific environment: Rustic animals that can feed on low quality pastures and do not need supplementary fodder.
Description of origin: imported from Germany and The Netherlands; locally adapted; 1970-1973 CORFO made massive imports, to distribute them to interested producers, universities and research centers, especially in the South of the country.
Locally adapted exotic dual purpose breed.

Color comments: multi coloured: red brown body, white head: belly, thorax, udder, rear quarters are white
Horn shape size and comments: 60% of the Altai White Head are without horns.
Other specific visible traits: The Aletai White Head is mediun sized. The Altai White Head has heavy head, wide forehead, deep thorax, wide broad withers, huge belly, rump with proper size, middling developed udder with teats of proper size and strong straight firm hooves.
Location within country: The Aletai White Head is distributed in Bu'erjing, Habahe and Aletai Counties, Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region; with Bu'erjing County as the central producing area.

Color comments: uni coloured: black and white
Horn shape size and comments: The horns are short, relatively slim and smooth. Horns of bulls wind ahead upwards like the letter of ""V"" and horns of cows wind right upwards like a semi~arc or the inverse character.
Other specific visible traits: compact constitution. The Apeijiaza has a head with moderate size, broad forehead, long straight narrow bridge of nose, big eyes with evident doublke eyes. The earlap is big and thick, with rare hairs on the spinouts end. The anemoscope is relatively small, humid with small nares. The base of neck is low and narrow, with underdeveloped muscles. The dewlap is well developed. Humps of bulls are bulls are evident. The back is long and smooth. The fore thorax is underdeveloped. The udders of cows are more developed than other scalpers and full of glands. The teats are endopleura and often like a columniation. The rear quarters are narrow, fleet and short. The tail is long beyond the hind shank. The quarters are straight and long and relatively slim with evident tendons. The hooves are small, round and firm with tight sews.
Location within country: the county of Gongbujiangda of Linzhi region in Tibet autonomous prefecture.

Description of origin: zebu; name for small or dwarf cattle in ancient China; compare Jiniu

Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is suitable for grazing in mountain areas.
Color comments: uni coloured: yellow, red
Other specific visible traits: quadrate conformation, and well-developed muscles. The males are rugged, and the females are trim and compact. The hump is high, and the dewlap is well developed.
Description of origin: including Xuanhan, Yunba, Qinba, Miao, Xizhen, Pingli and Ciya.
Location within country: The Bashan breed is native to the counties of Dachuan and Xuanhan in Sichuan Province, Shiyan City in Hubei Province as well as Xixiang, Zhenba, Pingli, etc. in Shaanxi Province.

Color comments: uni coloured: black with black muzzle and hooves
Other specific visible traits: The Bohai Black has low station, long wide body, and big heart girth.
Location within country: Wudi, Zhanhua, Lijing, Kenli of Huimin prefecture, Shandong Province.

Description of origin: developed breed. Using original Simmental of fast growth rate crossbred local breeds to develop this new breed. During the period of 1996 to 2001, the State had examined and approved a total number of 26 new animal breeds, including China Simmental cattle.

Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is widely adapted.
Special characteristic of product: This breed is known for a high milk yield.
Reference for special qualities: Ma Jun-Mu; Discussion on improving milk yield, J. Chinese dairy cattle 1986, no.4. Zhou Jian-Min, Study on nutrition needed for dairy cattle of high output, J. Chinese dairy cattle 1986, no.1
Color comments: multi coloured: black, white spotted
Description of origin: introduced breed improvement in cross-breeding with Japanese cattle
Performance data reference: Data forwarded from EAAP in 1991 FAO Breed Survey
Management conditions performance measur: Performance data were collected from animals kept under stationary conditions, housed for 12 months and fed on total concentrates.

Special characteristic of product: high milk yield
Description of origin: composite of Holstein-Friesian, Japanese Friesian and Pinzhou
Location within country: They are mainly distributed in suburbs of cities.

Color comments: uni coloured: yellow
Other specific visible traits: strong, compact conformation. The heads are a relatively long.
Location within country: Originated in the remote area in the southern Sichuan basin; Yingjing, Gulin, Xuyong and Qianjiang counties are the main producing area.

Specific reproductive characteristic: The Dabie Mountain reaches its sex maturity from 12 to 18 months old. Bulls are managed to first use at 2.5 years old.
Color comments: uni coloured: mainly yellow, brown and black are less common
Horn shape size and comments: ""Windward horns"", ""pork horns"" and ""bamboo shoot horns"" are found.
Other specific visible traits: Central Chinese type. compact and uniform conformation. The hump is evident and the dewlap develops well. The rear quarters are relatively broad and drooping, and the hooves are round, large and hard.
Location within country: Originated in counties of Jinzai, Huoshan, Yuexi, Liu'an and Shucheng in Anhui Province and counties of Huangpo, Dawu, Yingshan and Luotian in Hubei Province.
Performance data reference: N1-243 FAO Breed Survey Chinese Animal Livestock Breed Resources

Color comments: multi coloured: the Dangjiao varies in colour along with seasons, being red black in autumn and black in other seasons
Other specific visible traits: The Dangjiao has relatively short head, broad forehead, big mouth, high hump, long legs, short body and short tail.
Location within country: Originated in Chuansha, Nanhui and Fengxian counties, Shanghai Municipality.

Color comments: uni coloured: yellow
Other specific visible traits: males have a high, small hump and cows without humps.. The Dengchuan has trim constitution and the various parts of the body combine well. short small head. The back and waist is smooth and long, and the fore thorax is relatively narrow. The Dengchuan has big deep thorax, drooping rump, slender tail beyond hocks, small udder with short teats.
Location within country: Originated in Eryuan County and Dengchuan Prefecture, Yunnan Province.

Color comments: uni coloured: mainly black or yellow brown
Other specific visible traits: relatively short body. The Diqing has long narrow head, thin slender neck, flat withers, deep narrow fore thorax, narrow drooping rump, long slender tail, short slender quarters, evident joints, and small udder with short teats.
Location within country: Originated in Zhongdiandeqin and Weixi Counties, Diqing Tibet Autonomous Prefecture in the northwest of Yunnan Province.

Specific reproductive characteristic: The animals rarely mate under captivity and usually mate in the forests.
Other special qualities: Some crosses of Mithan and domestic cattle are frequently found in the jungle.
Color comments: multi coloured: dark grey with white stockings below the knees comment: Calves are born dark red in coloured which turns into the characteristic coloured by 6 months of age. They have a dorsal ridge on the crest of the shoulder
Other specific visible traits: short tail, big dewlap, flat forehead. ???In males, adult wither height is 125 cm and adult live weight 250 kg.
Comments management conditions: This breed is good at ascent and prefers living in groups. They are grazed outside throughout the entire year. The male are Fierce. The females hide themselves in the jungles or brushwood in the parturient period, leaving alone. The Dulong is large- framed.

Specific reproductive characteristic: The Ebian Spotted breed reaches its sex maturity at the age of 14~18 months and is managed to first breeding at about 3 years old.
Color comments: uni coloured: mainly yellow and white spotted
Horn shape size and comments: They have various horn shapes. Individuals without horns, however, may be found
Other specific visible traits: Bulls' heads are rugged while cows' are inclined and long. The Ebian Spotted has short broad neck, well-developed dewlap, and highly attached tail with thick head, short firm quarters and small round hooves without hump.
Location within country: Liangshan Yi Autonomous Prefecture, Sichuan Province.

Specific reproductive characteristic: The Fuzhou reaches its maturity at about 1 year of age.
Color comments: uni coloured: light yellow or light red
Horn shape size and comments: short ahead Bulls: swept horns.Cows: trim appearance and ""long men horns"".
Other specific visible traits: The Fuzhou has strong constitution, uniform conformation and rugged bones. Bulls have short head and broad forehead. The back and waist are smooth and straight, with relatively drooping rump, rugged quarters and hard hooves.
Location within country: The Fuzhou breed is native in the Fuzhou City, Liaoning Province, distributing in Jinxian and Xinjin Counties, Liaoning Province.

Specific reproductive characteristic: the cows show strong maternal ability.
Color comments: multi coloured: various colours
Other specific visible traits: The Ganzi Tibet is low and small, with uniform constitution, strong bones and compact muscles. The males have broad head, flat forehead, short thick neck and well-developed dewlap. The females have relatively long thin neck, under developed dewlap. The Ganzi Tibet has proper length of the body, smooth straight back and waist, quarters with proper length, uniform teats of middle size without additional teats.
Location within country: Originated in 18 counties of Ganzi Autonomous Region, Sichuan Province.

Color comments: uni coloured: mainly brown yellow and brown black, sometimes yellow or black
Horn shape size and comments: Various horn shapes may be found in Guangfeng, just like of horns like Chinese character.
Other specific visible traits: The Guangfeng has good conformation. The Guangfeng has broad heavy head. Cows are light and narrow. Humps of bulls are aerial, with the top of it like steamed bread. The Guangfeng has well developed thorax, well developed udders for cows with uniform equably distributed teats and thickset quarters.
Location within country: Originated in Guangfeng County, Jiangxi Province.

Color comments: uni coloured: yellow and brown black
Other specific visible traits: The Ji'an has compact and rugged conformation with thick strong bones. The coat is short and smooth. The males have rugged heads, and females with trium ones. For males, the fore quarters are well developed, with partly tumor~shaped tuberous hump being. While for the females, the rear quarters are well developed with underdeveloped hump. The belly is bulgy; the quarters are rugged; and the tail is long over hocks.
Location within country: The central producing area is located in Qingyuan, Ji'an, Taihe, Jishui, Anfu, Wan'an counties, Jiangxi Province.

Specific reproductive characteristic: The Jiaxian Red is relatively early~maturing and reach maturity at 10 months of age. Bulls are managed to first breeding at the age of 1 .5~2, and cows at the age of 2.
Color comments: uni coloured: red, light red and mauve, are found in the Miamian
Other specific visible traits: The Jiaxian Red has strong constitution and uniform conformation. The bull has relatively short neck and thick wither. The Jiaxian Red has comparatively well developed dewlap, tuberositas hump, relatively drooping rump, rugged quarters as well as large, circinal and firm hooves. Cows' udders develop well.
Location within country: Distributed in Luoyang, Kaifeng, Jiaxian, Baofeng, Lushan and adjoining counties in Henan Province.

Specific reproductive characteristic: The Jinan is early~maturing .Cows show estrous sigh from 7~8 months, and both bulls and cows are managed to first breeding at 2 years old.
Color comments: uni coloured: red, yellow
Other specific visible traits: The bull has tuberositas hump and developed dewlap; and the cow has medium sized dewlap with no hump. The back and waist are smooth and straight, with relatively drooping rump and rugged quarters.
Location within country: Originated in Daming, Weixian, Linzhang, Cheng'an, Guantao, Linxi, Weixian, Guangzhong and Pingxiang in Hebei Province.

Other specific visible traits: Zebu
Description of origin: name for small or dwarf cattle in ancient China

Color comments: uni coloured: mainly yellow
Horn shape size and comments: Males: thick horns and mainly fork horns. Females: tender horns and mainly hawk's paw horns.
Other specific visible traits: The Jinjiang has compact and rugged conformation with strong large bones and the joints are evident. The skin is smooth and flexible. The coat is short and dense. The males have a short thick neck and hugedewlap; the females have a long slim neck and relatively small dewlap. The hump is evident. The back is broad, smooth and straight.
Location within country: The central production area of Jinjiang Cattle is located in Gao'an City and Shanggao County in Jiangxi Province, distributing mainly over Wanzhai, Yifeng, Gao'an, Shanggao and Xinjian areas.
Additional performance parameters: In the prophase (2 for males, 3 before females), the Jinjiang grow rapidly, slowly in the evening.

Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is widely adapted.
Specific reproductive characteristic: This breed is known for high prolificacy.
Special characteristic of product: This breed is producing good quality meat.
Other special qualities: This breed is tolerant to roughage.
Reference for special qualities: Hou Wan Quan; Fattening abiliby and carcass quality test on Jinnan cattle. J. Chinese Yellow cattle, 1986, no. 2.
Color comments: uni coloured: red
Horn shape size and comments: short and thick horns with lateral orientation
Other specific visible traits: The animals have a large dewlap but no hump. The Jinnan is tall, strong and vigorous, and ruggedly built. Males have medium sized head and females have trim ones. short thick neck.
Description of origin: original indigenous breed cattle selected for long time B.C.
Location within country: Originated in Yuncheng and Linfen in Shanxi Province; the three counties~Wanrong, Hejin and Linyi, have the most cattle with best quality.
Management conditions performance measur: Performance was measured under stationary conditions. The animals were housed for 12 months per year and fed on grazing and fodder.

Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is known for its good adaptation to the local environment.
Specific reproductive characteristic: The Kazak is managed to first breeding at 2 years old.
Other special qualities: The animals fatten quickly.
Color comments: multi coloured: yellow and black
Other specific visible traits: The Kazak has medium or small sized head, relatively depressed forehead, medium length thin neck, underdeveloped wattle, low and flat withers. The back and waist are smooth and straight, with narrow rear quarters, relatively pinched and drooping rump, and relatively low tail head. Cows' udders are small and bowl shaped.
Location within country: The Kazak cattle breed is native to the northern areas of Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region, distributing over Yili Kazakstan Autonomous County, Boertana Inner Mongolian autonomous county, the wide mountainous area and grassland in Changji Hui Autonomous Prefecture.
Management conditions performance measur: Performance was measured under transhumant conditions and with total grazing.

Color comments: uni coloured: mainly yellow, sometimes black
Horn shape size and comments: The males have round horns with stubbed bases. While the females have short thin horn, and some of them with no horns.
Other specific visible traits: They have well developed dewlaps, and cows' inner side of the neck with skin drapes. The males have relatively well developed humps and dewlaps, relatively narrow rear quarters and relatively drooping rumps. The quarters are strong, and the tail is long with the trailhead beyond the hocks. The females have well developed udders and attach well.
Description of origin: South China Zebu type. including Xuwen and Hainan.
Location within country: Xuwen County, Guangdong Province and Qiongshan Couny, Hainan Province.

Color comments: uni coloured: black (42.1%) black and white (31.4%): and others are brown yellow, yellow white or brown
Horn shape size and comments: The horns are small, winding forth, upwards, forward and then twisted from the horn bases to the horn spire.
Other specific visible traits: uniform constitution and uniform conformation. The skin is thin and the coat is short. The Lhasa has a flat smooth head of proper size. Heads of cows are trim while those of bulls are strong and relatively broad. The humps of bulls are tuberous. The Lhasa has well-developed thorax, relatively short body, slender bones and middle-developed rear quarters. The quarters of males are strong and long, and those of the females are relatively short. The hooves are firm with a wide face.
Location within country: Originated in Linzhou and Duilongdeqing Districts of Lhasa City, Tibet Autonomous Region.

Color comments: multi coloured: various colours, most common are yellow, spotted, red purple and black
Horn shape size and comments: The Liang Mountain have horns with shapes of""Baozi horns"""", sharp horns"""", taro horns"",""Zhaoyang horns"" ,and etc.
Other specific visible traits: comparatively short body, uniform, compact and strong conformation. The head and the neck are of proper length. For bulls, the dewlap is well developed with wrinkles and high hump; the fore quarters are higher than the rear quarters. For cows, the dewlap is less with low thin withers; the rear quarters are higher than the fore quarters. The thorax is broad and deep with smooth straight back and waist, drooping rump of middle length. The cow's udder is small with uniform teats.
Location within country: Originated in the counties or cities of Liangshan Yi Autonomous Prefecture and the counties of Panzhihua city, Sichuan Province.

Specific reproductive characteristic: The Liping reaches sex maturity comparatively earlier than other breeds.
Color comments: uni coloured: black or yellow are most common but brown, black and white as well as yellow and white may also be found
Horn shape size and comments: Horns of the females are short tender upswept and usually black brown. Horns of the males are rugged and mainly ""bamboo shoot horns"".
Other specific visible traits: The head is of middle size and the bulls' are a relatively broad. Then males have broad flat forehead, big round mouth and deep muzzle. The females have long thin necks. The males have short necks with well-developed dewlaps and tall hollow humps as well. The Liping has broad deep thorax, flat straight back and waist and firm hooves.
Location within country: Originated in Liping, Congjiang and Jinxiu counties in southeast Guizhou Province.

Specific reproductive characteristic: The Luxi reaches sex maturity comparatively later than other breeds. The Luxi shows good breeding performance. The females reach sex maturity early and are able to be pregnant at the age of 8 months.
Special characteristic of product: This breed is producing fine quality meat.
Other special qualities: This breed has good strength for draught.
Color comments: uni coloured: light yellow to red and brown, yellow is rather common, the majority of them have pink areas: eye socket, muzzle, underside of belly, and inner side of quarters
Other specific visible traits: uniform conformation, with tight fine constitution. There are three types on the basis of body conformation - high shaft type, zhuadihu type, and the intermediate type.
Location within country: Originated in Heze and Jining prefecture, southwest of Shandong Province.

Adaptability to specific environment: The animals are well adapted to a harsh climate. They withstand temperature fluctuations -50°C to 35°C.
Color comments: uni coloured: brindle or reddish-brown, occasionally yellow, black multi coloured: occasionally pied
Other specific visible traits: Turano-Mongolian type. The Mango has short broad rugged head, long ahead swept horns, underdeveloped wattle and low withers. The back and waist are smooth and straight, with short narrow rear quarters, drooping rump, short quarters and hard hooves. The basal area of cows' udders is large and broad with small teats.
Location within country: Originated in Inner Mongolia; distributing in Provinces of Heilongjiang, Hebei, Shanxi, Shaanxi, Qinghai, Jilin and Liaoning, Xinjiang and Ningxia Autonomous Region.
Comments management conditions: There is no free access to water, the animals graze all year under severe weather and unfavouable feeding conditions (poor vegetation).
Additional performance parameters: The fore quarters develop better than the rear quarters.

Color comments: uni coloured: black, yellow
Horn shape size and comments: The horns are mainly ""Longmen horns"" and ""shoulder pole shaped horns"".
Other specific visible traits: The Meng Mountain has compact conformation and strong constitution, with well developed fore quarters and relatively small body type. The males have short thick necks, well-developed muscles, and evident humps. The females have trim head; relatively long neck, and whorls on the forehead. The nibble body is smooth and straight with sprung ribs. The belly is well developed and not sagging. The rear quarters are chubby; the tail is long beyond the hocks; and the tail is spindle shaped. The quarters are strong with big hard hooves.
Location within country: Originated in the Yimeng mountainous area in central and south of Shandong Province.

Special characteristic of product: Meat is tender and delicious.
Color comments: uni coloured: females are often light yellow, green yellow or red yellow, while the males are black or with a black back
Horn shape size and comments: The horns are taper shape, splaying like a character and winding forwards and upwards.
Other specific visible traits: good compact conformation and is thickly muscled. The head is a bit big. The bulls has well developed humps with an average height of 13~18cm and huge dewlaps with an average breadth of 18~20cm. The Southern Fujian has well-developed thorax, smooth straight waist and back, drooping rump, strong quarters and black round hooves.
Location within country: Originated in Zhangpu, Longhai, Pinghe, Tong'an, Nan'an and Zhangzhou Prefectures in Fujian Province.

Color comments: multi coloured: yellow and red: light yellow or black is found under the quarters
Horn shape size and comments: For the males, there are two horn shapes of ""bamboo shoot"" and ""hawk claw"". Horns of the females are short and small.
Other specific visible traits: The body of Nandan is low, rugged and relatively short with back line. The head is short and broad and the dewlap develops well. The breast is a relatively sagging and the rump is drooping and round. The females have underdeveloped udders. The tail is long beyond the hocks.
Location within country: Originated in Nandan County, Sanbao of Tian'e County, Bogong of Hechi County, and Xianan of Huanjiang County in Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region.

Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is known for adaptability to cold and hot climatic conditions.
Specific reproductive characteristic: This breed is known for high prolificacy. The females are managed to first mating at the beginning of 2.
Special characteristic of product: This breed is producing fine quality beef (good muscularity). The meat seems bright red with marbling.
Other special qualities: This breed is known for good strength for draught.
Reference for special qualities: Bureau of Ani. Sci. of Nanyang Region; Report on breeding effect in last ten years. Chinese J. of Yellow cattle 1986, no.2. Wang Guan-Se; Research on weaining weight of Nanyang cattle; Chinese J. of Yellow Cattle, 1986; no 3.
Color comments: uni coloured: yellow, red or yellow and white in coloured.
Horn shape size and comments: short horns, lateral pointing tips. mainly ""radish horns"".
Other specific visible traits: males: medium hump 8--9 cm. well developed muscle ,thin skin and fine hairs.
Description of origin: indigenous breed developed through long-time selection and improvement
Location within country: The Nanyang breed had its origin in the region of Nanyang, Henan Province, principally distributed in Nanyang city and in Nanyang, Tanghe and Dengxian counties.
Management conditions performance measur: Performance was measured under stationary conditions. The animals were housed for 12 months per year and fed on grazing and fodder.

Other name: Guanling y, Guxi y, Longlin, Wenshan y, Guangnan
Specific reproductive characteristic: The Panjiang breed reaches its sex maturity at the age of 8~10 months.
Color comments: uni coloured: mainly yellow in coloured, and less with brown and black multi coloured: some spotted ones, however, may occasionally be found
Other specific visible traits: males are humped. relatively long dewlap. The males' humps are evidently 8~15cm above the back line, and females' humps are unconspicuous. The Panjiang has deep and relatively narrow thorax, drooping rump, slender tail with relatively high tail head, straight fore limbs and evident tendons of hind limbs. Udders of cows are comparatively small with short thin teats.
Location within country: Originated in the border area of Yunnan, Guizhou and Guangxi.

Color comments: uni coloured: yellow, red
Other specific visible traits: The Pinglu Mountain is undersized. The Pinglu Mountain has well developed thorax and rear quarters, relatively short quarters, and firm hooves resisting attrition.
Location within country: Originated in Pinglu and Xiaxian Counties in Shanxi Province.

Color comments: multi coloured: yellow or red yellow and few of them have a black line on the back
Horn shape size and comments: horns are mainly short and small with the tines outward.
Other specific visible traits: The Pingwu is large~framed and has uniform conformation. Heads of the males are heavy. The dewlap develops well; the hump is evident (especially for males). The rump is flat, straight, relatively drooping and under developed. The tail is light, proper in size and near the tarsus.
Location within country: The central producing area is located in the 25 townships of Pingwu County in Sichuan Province.

Horn shape size and comments: horns mainly winding outwards and upright then.
Other specific visible traits: The Chaidamu has strong compact constitution, quadrate body shape forconcurrent use. The Chaidamu has short wide head, short thin dewlap without plica, short narrow drooping rump, big round belly, relatively low quarters and firm hooves of medium size.
Location within country: Dulan and Wulan Counties and Ge'ermu City in the edge of the Chaidamu Basin in Qinghai Province.

Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is known for adaptability to hilly country-side.
Specific reproductive characteristic: This breed is known for high prolificacy.
Special characteristic of product: This breed is producing good quality meat. The meat is tender and has a distinct marble-texture. The draught powers are 475.5kg, 333.6kg and 281.2kg for the bull, the bullock and the cow respectively.
Other special qualities: This breed is known for good strength for draught.
Reference for special qualities: Stationary of Animal Science of Shanxi province; Selection results in last ten years; J. Chinese Yellow cattle 1986, No.1 Dong Wei-An, Fattening experiment of Qinchuan castrates, J. Chinese Yellow cattle 1986, No.2
Color comments: uni coloured: mauve, red and yellow in Qinchuan
Horn shape size and comments: short horned, lateral pointing tips. The horn length is about 10cm for females and 14.5cm for males.
Other specific visible traits: cervical hump (per Mason), well developed dewlap. The bull's head is comparatively big with broad forehead, flat face, big eyes and square mouth, while the cow is trim. The withers of the males are high and bread while the females' are low and bread.
Description of origin: indigenous breed improved through long-time selection, belongs to the Central Plain Yellow cattle group
Location within country: Originated in Guanzhong Prefecture of Shaanxi Province, distributing over 27 counties or cities in Guanzhong Plain, Shaanxi Province.
Performance data reference: Data forwarded from EAAP in 1991 F76-16
Management conditions performance measur: Performance was measured under stationary conditions. The animals were housed for 12 months per year and fed on grazing and fodder.
Additional performance parameters: At moderate nutrient level and feeding up to 18 to 24 months, dressing and meat percentages are 58-61 and 50-52, respectively, with 75-76% lean meat.

Other name: Krasnaya Nemetskaua, Red Colonist (obsulete synonym), Red German, Red Ukrainian, Krasnaya Stepnaya
Adaptability to specific environment: This breed is well adapted to continental climate.
Color comments: uni coloured: red of various shades
Other specific visible traits: dairy type conformation
Description of origin: composite of Red East Friesian, Angeln and Ukrainian Grey, later also Swiss Brown, East Friesian: In 1930, China imported dual-purpose Shorthorn, Brown Swiss and Anatayckas cattle to improve the local breeds in Inner Mongolia, Jilin, Liaoning and Hebei provinces.
Management conditions performance measur: Performance data were collected form animals kept under stationary conditions, housed for 5-6 months per year and with grazing all year round and subjected to fattening for only a short period.
Additional performance parameters: There are 3 main zonal types, Zaporozhye (high milk production), Crimean (combine high mily yields with high fat content) and Donetsk (high milk production with high live weight). The milk yield is three to five times higher than compared to Mongolian cows.

Description Of Specific Uses: This breed is usually used for tractive power, with the average draught power of 400kg.
Color comments: multi coloured: various colours exist but uniform black and black and white are most common
Other specific visible traits: This breed is huge than other Tibet's with long body.
Location within country: the grass roots of south Tibet of Rigeze region in Tibet autonomous prefecture and the south foot of the Himalaya Mountain.

Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is known for its adaptability to a cold climate. No tolerance to hot and wet climate is reported for this breed.
Specific reproductive characteristic: This breed is known for the low calving rate.
Special characteristic of product: They have a good carcass quality and lean meat.
Reference for special qualities: Bai Jin-Shan; Study on milkability of Sanhe cattle Chinese J. Animal Science 1984, No.5 Li Min et al.; Beef performance of Sanhe cattle Animal Husbandry and Veterinarian 1986, No.1
Color comments: multi coloured: red, white
Horn shape size and comments: curved horns with upward pointing tips
Description of origin: composite of Simmental, Yaloslav Yakut (male) and indigenous breed (female)
Location within country: Hulunbeier Region of Inner Mongolia, Sanhe Region of Energulayou Banner
Performance data reference: Data forwarded from EAAP in 1991 FAO Breed Survey F76-15
Management conditions performance measur: Performance was measured under stationary conditions. The animals were housed for 12 months per year and fed on grazing and concentrates.
Additional performance parameters: Since 1945, animal breeders have selected and bred cattle sistematically. Sanhe cows could produce 4000 kg of milk annually, with a fat content of 4 %. They also have a good carcass quality and lean meat. The dressing and meat percentages of steers were between 50 and 55 percent and 44 and 48 percent, re spectively, under normal feeding conditions without fattening.

Color comments: uni coloured: mainly yellow
Other specific visible traits: great head, broad forehead, short upward horns, well-developed dewlap and relatively high hump. The neck and shoulder are well~knit. The fore quarters develop well, the medium quarters are relatively long and the rear quarters are straight and smooth.
Location within country: Originated in Sanjiang, Baishi, Shuimo of Wenchuan County, Aba Autonomous Prefecture, Sichuan Province.

Color comments: uni coloured: mainly yellowish
Horn shape size and comments: The Taihang has various horn shapes and the ""windward horns"" are common.
Other specific visible traits: The neck is slender with mezzo length. The females have relatively girth of paunches with underdeveloped udders however. The Taihang has drooping rump and long tail with many hocks.
Location within country: Originated in over 20 counties in the west mountainous area of Hebei Province; most Taihang cattle are distributed in counties of Laiyuan, Yixian, Tangxian, Quyang, Fuping, Xingtang, Lingshou, Pingshan, Jinjing, Zanhuang, Lincheng, Neiqiu, Xingtai, Shahe, Wu'an, Shexian and Cixian, Hebei Province.

Color comments: uni coloured: light brown, grey or black
Other specific visible traits: The Taiwan has light fine head, biggish auris, small but evident hump, preferably developed mid body, under developed rear quarters, very slim cannon circumference and underdeveloped udder.
Description of origin: hardly any purebred of Taiwan in 1981
extinct by crossing with Indian breeds to Taiwan Zebu

Color comments: uni coloured: usually yellow, red or brown, also black and grey
Description of origin: composite of Chinese Yellow, Red Sindhi and Kankrej
Management conditions performance measur: Performance data were collected at Hengchun Research Station, Taiwan Livestock Research Institute.
Additional performance parameters: - body weight at weaning (205 days old): 130 130 kg (males) and 122 kg (females); - yearling weight: 223 kg (males) and 218 kg (females); - feed conversion (gain/dry feed): 0.096 kg (males) and 0.079 kg (females);

Specific reproductive characteristic: The females are managed to first breeding at about 2.5 years old and males 3.5 years old.
Color comments: uni coloured: mainly red as well as black multi coloured: white spotted
Other specific visible traits: dwarf. Heads are flat and straight with mezzo size. The males' humps are relatively high. The cows' udders are small with orderly teats. The Tibetan has drooping rump, slender quarters and firm hooves.
Location within country: Tibet and QinghaiDistributed in the middle and lower reaches of Yarlung Zangbo River, east part of the Himalaya Mountain and the lower reaches of Sanjiang River Valley, Tibet.

Color comments: Yellow
Description of origin: Wenshan Autonomous Prefecture of Guizhou Province.
Location within country: Wenshan Autonomous Prefecture of Guizhou Province.

Specific reproductive characteristic: The Wannan is managed to have first breeding at 10 months and 1 year old for males and females, respectively.
Special characteristic of product: The meat is fresh, tender and delicious.
Other specific visible traits: The Wannan has relatively small and good conformation with slim quarters. There are two types of the Wannan breed: the rugged and the trim. The former has rugged head, short neck, well developed dewlap, thick~fleshed rear quarters, slender tail, and relatively short quarters; and the hump of cows is high. The latter is fine and slim type with slender and smooth neck; and the males with relatively hump.
Location within country: The Wannan breed is native to Anhwei Province, distributing over the vast hill and mountainous areas beyond the Yangtze River and areas on both banks of the Yangtze.

Description of origin: name for humpless cattle in ancient China

Color comments: uni coloured: yellow or brown yellow
Horn shape size and comments: The horns of bulls are thickset and patulous, with the shapes of"" across shoulder pole horns"" or ""Long men horns"". Female: short slim horns spreading upwards.
Other specific visible traits: This breed has huge head and broad forehead. The females have trium heads. The Wenling High Hump also has aerial humps, well developed fore quarters, under developed rear quarters, rugged bones, beefy muscles, broad deep thorax, broad waist, compact belly and well developed udder of a cow with equably distributed teats.
Location within country: Originated in Wenling County, Zhejiang Province.

Specific reproductive characteristic: The Weining reaches sex maturity comparatively later than other breeds.
Color comments: uni coloured: mainly yellow, less yellow-brown and black, however white and yellow may also be found
Horn shape size and comments: The horns are of various horn shapes, mainly ""radish horns"" and ""hawk claw horns"".
Other specific visible traits: The Weining has long and trium head, flat straight forehead, broad anemoscope, square mouth, short neck and under well developed dewlap. The Weining has comparatively tall hump for bulls, flat and straight for cows. The thorax is deep but not broad enough. The Weining has smooth straight back and waist, full waist, relatively drooping but high rump, slender but firm quarters, upright fore quarters and firm hooves. The rear quarters often have narrow or forward hooves. The tail attaches highly and is long beyond the hocks.
Location within country: Weining, Hezhang, Bijie and Nayong Counties in Guizhou Province.

Color comments: uni coloured: yellow, brown or black
Other specific visible traits: The Weizhou has head with proper length, flat forehead, wide round horn floor. The neck is thick and short with well-developed dewlap. The hump of the males is evident with an average height of 12.4cm. For the males, the thorax is deep and broad with smooth straight back and waist t, drooping rump and well-developed muscles. For the females, the udder is uniform, and the quarters low and thin.
Location within country: Originated in the two islands of Weizhou and Xieyang of Beihai City in Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region.

Color comments: uni coloured: black
Horn shape size and comments: The horns are black and comparatively small. And the horns of males are usually ""radish horns"", while those of the females are often ""qiangcai horns"".
Other specific visible traits: strong constitution, uniform body, and compact conformation. The neck is broad and short; the hump is well developed with middle or relatively high height; the quarters are strong and upright and the joints are firm.
Location within country: The central producing area is Wuchuan County, Zunyi Prefecture, Guizhou Province.

Color comments: uni coloured: mostly yellow
Other specific visible traits: elatively long neck. The males has fleshy humps 6~8cm above the back line, and females with inconspicuous ones. The Wuling has drooping rump, rugged quarters with medium length, in tilted hock of hind limbs, upright style of the shoe, hard hooves and relatively long tail.
Location within country: Originated in the border area of Hunan, Hubei and Guizhou Provinces.

Adaptability to specific environment: The animals endure wide temperature ranges. Consequently, they are distributed across mountain and coastal areas.
The breed is known for its adaptability to a cold climate in the local environment (mountains and hills)
Specific reproductive characteristic: This breed is known for low fertility.
Special characteristic of product: Good meat/milk body conformation is reported for this breed.
Color comments: uni coloured: brown
Horn shape size and comments: curved horns with forward pointing tips
Description of origin: composite of Ala-Tau, Brown Swiss (male) and indigenous breed (female)
Location within country: Yili and Tachong Region of Xinjiang
Performance data reference: Data forwarded from EAAP in 1991 FAO Breed Survey F76-15
Management conditions performance measur: Performance was measured on animals kept under transhumant conditions. The animals were housed for 6 months per year and fed on grazing and fodder.
Additional performance parameters: Under grazing on natural pasture the dressing percentage for18-month-old steers has been 47.4%, 50.5 for 30-month-old and 53.1for adult steers, with respective meat percentages of 36.3, 38.4 and 39.3.

Special characteristic of product: Meat is slim, tender and tasting delicious.
Horn shape size and comments: The horns are relatively broad and long head, and mainly ""longmen horns"".
Other specific visible traits: The males have stubby necks, and females have slender ones. The dewlap is underdeveloped while the hump is evident.
Location within country: Originated in Peixian and Tongshan Counties of Xuzhou Prefecture, Jiangshu Province.

Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is known for adaptability to cold climatic conditions.
Specific reproductive characteristic: The Yanbian reaches its maturity at 14 and 13 months of age for bulls and cows respectively.
Special characteristic of product: This breed is producing fine quality meat.
Other special qualities: This breed is known for good strength for draught. Grazing all year round in the severe local weather conditions has resulted in thicker skins, coarser hair, sturdier bones, broader chests and a better constitution, and they are well adapted to poor feeding (tolerance to coarse-feed) and management conditions.
Color comments: uni coloured: yellow
Horn shape size and comments: thickness of horn, backward printing tips
Other specific visible traits: The Yanbian has strong constitution and well developed muscle. The Yanbian has square head, broad forehead, thick scur and thick tuberositas neck.
Description of origin: indigenous breed, improved through long-time selection: belong to the Northern Yellow cattle group. including Yanbian, Chaoxian and Yanjiang.
Location within country: Distributed in the Provinces of Jilin, Heilongjiang and Liaoning
Performance data reference: Data forwarded from EAAP in 1991 FAO Breed Survey
Management conditions performance measur: Performance was measured on animals kept under stationary conditions, housed for 12 months and fed on grazing and concentrates.

Specific reproductive characteristic: This breed is managed to breeding at the age of 2 years.
Color comments: uni coloured: black, brown, red, yellow, grey and white
Horn shape size and comments: All the males have horns, but most females have no horns or only have very short horns. And most of the horns are stubbed. The horn shapes of ""long horns"",""short horns"" and inverse character can be found in males.
Other specific visible traits: This breed has a tumor on the forward upside of the hump with an average height of 12~15cm. The bulls' dewlaps develop very well, extending to the belly. The body is round and long with the fore quarters well developed, strong and powerful and the rear quarters like a round canister.
Location within country: Originated in the tropical and subtropical regions in the south, southeast and central of Yunnan Province, The central producing areas are Dehong Dai nationality, counties of Ruili, Luxi and Wanting of Jingpo nationality autonomous region, Xishuangbanna autonomous prefecture in Lincang region and some counties of Simao prefecture.

Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is known for its adaptability towards heat, humidity and a hilly environment.
Specific resistance or tolerance: The animals are reported to show resistance to tick-flies.
Specific reproductive characteristic: The animals are known for their high prolificacy.
Color comments: uni coloured: brown multi coloured: black, grey, red, yellow
Other specific visible traits: males have a high hump (12--20 cm) and large dewlap
Description of origin: indigenous breed improved through long-time selection
Location within country: Dehong, Xishuangbanna and Lincang region of Yunnan
Performance data reference: Data forwarded from EAAP in 1991 FAO Breed Survey
Management conditions performance measur: Performance data were measured on animals kept under stationary conditions, housed for 12 months and fed on grazing and fodder.
Comments management conditions: The animals are housed during night time.

Specific reproductive characteristic: The females are managed to first breeding at about 2 years old and male at 2.
Color comments: uni coloured: red, brown, yellow
Other specific visible traits: relatively large, with uniform constitution, thin skin, fine hairs, rugged bones and well developed muscles. The males have short thick necks as well as well developed humps. The females have slender necked and well-developed udders.
Description of origin: Central Chinese type, similar to Nanyang
Location within country: Originated in the northern part of Zaoyang County in Hubei Province.

Special characteristic of product: Their milking performance is outstanding.
Color comments: multi coloured: various colours of black, yellow, white, brown, sandy, red, and most of them have white spots
Other specific visible traits: compact shapely constitution. Humps of bulls are evident than those of cows, and few of them are tall and big. Usually the dewlap is underdeveloped. The neck is of proper length, and looks a bit thin and weak. The back is often smooth and straight with small switch.
Location within country: the county of Nielamu of Rigeze region in Tibet autonomous prefecture, lying between the mountains of Himalaya and Laguigang.

Special characteristic of product: The meat is tender, sweet~smelling and without the smell of mutton.
Color comments: uni coloured: mainly yellow, light yellow, grass white, black or red
Horn shape size and comments: The bulls have short rugged horns
Other specific visible traits: uniform constitution and uniform conformation. The Zhaotong has a head of proper length. The bulls hav evident hump while the cows are without humps. Relatively drooping rump, medium sized quarters with hocks lying inside a relatively and slender tail with low tailhead.
Location within country: Originated in the eleven counties of Zhaotong City, Yunnan Province.
Additional performance parameters: The pressed skin is tough and tensile with close texture.

Specific reproductive characteristic: The Zhoushan is managed to first breeding at 2 years old.
Color comments: uni coloured: black
Other specific visible traits: The Zhoushan has short glossy hair, short head, broad forehead, well developed dewlap with an average length of 30cm, aerial humps for males, slightly protuberant humps for females, smooth straight back, smooth broad waist and a ""mounting circle"" in the back line. And the udder is a relatively big and sagging.
Location within country: Originated in Dinghai District of Zhoushan City, Zhejiang Province.

Other name: Djakoré, Méré, Taurin du Kaartaa, Mande
Color comments: uni coloured: yellow-brown to red
Description of origin: composite of N'Dama and Sudanese Fulani (zebu): The population is almost stabilized with respect to its composition of Zebu and N'Dama.

Cultural Uses: Cultural and religious ceremonies, Research, Tourist attraction / touristic potential
Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is known for hardiness towards living conditions in the hot, humid tropics.
Specific resistance or tolerance: This breed is reported to be tolerant to trypanosomiasis and tick-borne diseases.
Reference for special qualities: Reviewed by G.S.Aboagye et al.; World Animal Review, n.78, 1994/1
Color comments: uni coloured: black multi coloured: black with white patches
Horn shape size and comments: males: crown, half-moon or hook shaped females: smaller horns than in males
Description of origin: variety of West African Savannah Shorthorn
Performance data reference: F20(2) -120 FAO Breed Survey W78 F78-33, 48
Management conditions performance measur: Available information on production characteristics of this breed have been compiled and reviewed for animals kept under different management conditions.

Other name: Mayombe, Mayumbe, Race des lagunes, Lagunaire
Cultural Uses: Cultural and religious ceremonies, Research, Tourist attraction / touristic potential
Adaptability to specific environment: adapted to humid climate conditions and forest areas
Specific resistance or tolerance: This breed is reported to be trypanotolerant.
Color comments: multi coloured: black, white
Other specific visible traits: very small cattle, short legged
Description of origin: variety of West African Dwarf Shorthorn: Lagune is the name used for Dwarf Shorthorn cattle in French-speaking West and Central Africa.

Other name: Boyenca, Fouta Jallon, Fouta Longhorn, Futa, Malinke, Mandingo, N'dama Peti, Outa Malinke, Boenca
Cultural Uses: Cultural and religious ceremonies, Research, Tourist attraction / touristic potential
Adaptability to specific environment: The animals can survive under very humid conditions.
Specific resistance or tolerance: This breed is reported to be trypanotolerant.
Other special qualities: The animals are well known for their hardiness.
Color comments: uni coloured: usually fawn, red or brown, occasionally or black multi coloured: occasionally pied
Other specific visible traits: small animals
Management conditions performance measur: Performance data represent averages from studies conducted at village level and on station at the Institut des Savanes.

Provision Uses: Draught power, General crossbreeding, Meat, Milk
Adaptability to specific environment: Heat tolerant.
Other special qualities: This is a good meat animal which fattens easily. This breed has the ability to walk long distances.
Color comments: uni coloured: light grey
Management conditions performance measur: Performance was measured on animals kept under transhumant conditions and fed on total grazing.
Comments management conditions: A small number of the breed (29%) are used for traction in the cotton areas, these are also fed on fodder and kitchen scraps.

Color comments: uni coloured: black, brown multi coloured: pied
Description of origin: variety of West African Savannah Shorthorn
Location within country: North-eastern part of the boundary of the Bakosi tribe on the western slopes of Mount Manengouba in the Bangemu Subdivision of South-west Province

Description of origin: variety of West African Dwarf Shorthorn
Location within country: Foot of Mt. Cameroons, South-western Cameroon

Description of origin: variety of West African Savannah Shorthorn

Color comments: uni coloured: red often with white face and belly multi coloured: red pied often with white face and belly
Description of origin: variety of Goudali de l'Adamaoua with Red Bororo blood

Color comments: uni coloured: usually dark red, also black or pied
Other specific visible traits: well developed hump in males
Description of origin: West African Shorthorned Zebu type, similar to Azaouak
Management conditions performance measur: Performance data were collected from animals kept under stationary conditions, or transhumant conditions in the dry season and fed on total grazing.
Comments management conditions: The animals encounter the necessity to search for both water and feed during the dry season.

Color comments: uni coloured: red multi coloured: red, white
Other specific visible traits: West African Zebu type

Specific resistance or tolerance: This breed is reported to be trypanotolerant
Special characteristic of product: Cattle of this breed plays an important role in the traditional life of the Kapsiki people, they are used in much the same way as Muturu cattle in Nigeria for dowries, special feasts and rituals.
Color comments: uni coloured: black multi coloured: black, white
Other specific visible traits: small animals
Description of origin: variety of West African Savannah Shorthorn

Other name: Baharie, Bare, Borrie, Boudouma, Buduma, Chad, Dongole, Kuburi, White Lake Chad, Kouri
Specific resistance or tolerance: This breed is reported to be trypanotolerant
Other special qualities: The animals can stay afloat and swim long distances.
Color comments: uni coloured: white, occasionally with spots
Performance data reference: FAO Breed Survey F2-30 Bourzat D., Idriss A., Zeuh V. (1992). Malbrant et al (1949).
Management conditions performance measur: Performance data were collected from animals kept under stationary conditions, fed on total grazing.

Other name: Akou, Bunaji, Foulbe Blanc, White Bororo, White Kano, Yakanaji, White Fulani
Color comments: uni coloured: usually white with black spots
Horn shape size and comments: lyre shaped horns, up to 51 cm
Other specific visible traits: large dewlaps, especially in males
Location within country: mainly found in the western part of the North-west Province and the western part of Adamaoua Province

Other name: Djafoun, Fellata, Gabassae, Gadehe, Hanagamba, Kreda, Mbororo, Ogha, Rahaza, Red Bororo, Red Fulani, Brahaza
Color comments: uni coloured: mahogany, sometimes white
Horn shape size and comments: very long (up to 63 cm) lyre shaped horns
Other specific visible traits: slender body with long legs

Other name: Boyenca, Fouta Longhorn, Fouta jallon, Futa, Malinke, Mandingo, N'dama peti, Outa malinke, Boenca
Adaptability to specific environment: The animals can survive under very humid conditions.
Specific resistance or tolerance: This breed is reported to be trypanotolerant.
Other special qualities: The animals are well known for their hardiness.
Color comments: uni coloured: usually fawn, red or brown, occasionally or black multi coloured: occasionally pied
Other specific visible traits: small animals
Location within country: mainly in the palm plantations in the Littoral and South Provinces

Color comments: uni coloured: brown, roan, multi coloured: red pied, black pied

Other name: Doayo, M'bougi, M'bouye, Namchi, Namji, Namshi, Poli, Kirdi
Specific resistance or tolerance: This breed is reported to be trypanotolerant.
Color comments: uni coloured: black, occasionally brown multi coloured: black and white pied, spotted, occasionally brown spotted
Description of origin: variety of West African Savannah Shorthorn

Color comments: uni coloured: red or red pied
Other specific visible traits: Zebu
Description of origin: Brahman x Adamawa. Original of Wakwa

Color comments: uni coloured: black, red, brown, dun comments: pied or speckled with white
Description of origin: variety of Goudali de l'Adamaoua with Muturu blood

Color comments: uni coloured: red brown
Other specific visible traits: well developed muscle
Description of origin: developed in South Africa from Hottentot cattle crossed with European breeds in the 15th century
Location within country: south Katanga and Lomami, Marungu, Kundelungu and Kasaï

Color comments: uni coloured: usually red, also black multi coloured: also red pied
Other specific visible traits: Sanga-Zebu intermediate, great variability within breed
Description of origin: local breed developed in the area of Ituri by crossing Ankole Bahema and Lugware a few centuries ago in the triangle ranging between Blukwa, Niza and Nioka
Location within country: spread in the zones of Njungu, Nioka and Mahagi

Specific resistance or tolerance: susceptiblity to the tsetse fly
Description of origin: resultant of crossings between Sanga type cattle and long horn cattle raised by the ancient Egyptians
Location within country: Provinces of Kivu, mountainous areas from 1.200 to 2.000 m of altitude above the trypano zone

Specific resistance or tolerance: susceptiblity to the tsetse fly
Other specific visible traits: long body, long legs, males have a small hump, females often without hump

Specific resistance or tolerance: susceptiblity to the tsetse fly
Color comments: uni colour: red
Other specific visible traits: similar to Kigezi
Description of origin: variety of Ankole: smaller and has shorter horns
Location within country: Provinces of Kivu, mountainous areas from 1.200 to 2.000 m of altitude above the trypano zone

Other name: Lagunaire, Mayombe, Mayumbe, Race des lagunes, Lagune
Specific resistance or tolerance: This breed is reported to be trypanotolerant.
Color comments: multi coloured: black, with various nuances of brown, less frequently black spotted
Other specific visible traits: very small cattle, short legged
Description of origin: variety of West African Dwarf Shorthorn: Lagune is the name used for Dwarf Shorthorn cattle in French-speaking West and Central Africa.
Comments management conditions: a few thousands heads are used in plantations of palm trees, hevea and coffee to maintain the under growth

Description of origin: descended from Angola cattle with European influence

Color comments: multi coloured: black pied, grey or red pied
Description of origin: variety of Small East African Zebu, originated from Asia, it entered through the East coast 700 A.D and was brought to Congo by the Lugware tribe
Location within country: district of Ituri on the high plateaus, along the lake Mobutu to the plain of Semlinki

Adaptability to specific environment: The animals wade in pastures and graze on 'floating' grass.
Specific resistance or tolerance: This breed is reported not to be as trypanotolerant as N'Dama or Lagune.
Color comments: uni coloured: brown
Other specific visible traits: Sanga type, long ears
Description of origin: resultant of crossings between Hereford, Devon, Africander, Friesian, Shorthorn and some Belgium breeds, developed in the colonial time on the Mateba island located on the Congo river, close to Boma in Low Congo
Location within country: Mateba Island, in the mouth of River Zaire, Cataractes subregion of Bas-Zaire and Pinanga in Kasai Occidenta

Other name: Boyenca, Fouta Jallon, Fouta Longhorn, Futa, Malinke, Mandingo, N'dama Peti, Outa Malinke, Boenca
Adaptability to specific environment: The animals can survive under very humid conditions.
Specific resistance or tolerance: This breed is reported to be trypanotolerant and also resistant to Piroplasmosis.
Special characteristic of product: Leather of excellent quality called "" vachette de guinée ".
Other special qualities: The animals are well known for their hardiness.
Color comments: uni coloured: usually fawn, red or brown, occasionally or black multi coloured: occasionally pied
Other specific visible traits: small elipometric size with marked sexual dimorphism
Description of origin: continually imported; West African Small Humpless Longhorn originally from Fouta Djallon in Guinée

Other name: Mayombe, Mayumbe, Race des lagunes, Lagunaire
Specific resistance or tolerance: This breed is reported to be trypanotolerant.
Other special qualities: The Lagune breed is very docile and easy to control for the local breeders.
Color comments: multi coloured: black, white
Other specific visible traits: very small cattle, short legged
Description of origin: variety of West African Dwarf Shorthorn: Lagune is the name used for Dwarf Shorthorn cattle in French-speaking West and Central Africa; imported from Benin and the Ivory Coast
Management conditions performance measur: Performance data were collected from animals kept under stationary conditions, fed on concentrates.
Comments management conditions: The supply of concentrates in the country farms is very irregular. Cattle get their water from natural sources and are not housed.

Other name: Boyenca, Fouta Longhorn, Fouta jallon, Futa, Malinke, Mandingo, N'dama peti, Outa malinke, Boenca
Adaptability to specific environment: The animals can survive under very humid conditions.
Specific resistance or tolerance: This breed is reported to be trypanotolerant.
Other special qualities: The animals are well known for their hardiness.
Color comments: uni coloured: usually fawn, red or brown, occasionally or black multi coloured: occasionally pied
Other specific visible traits: small animals
Description of origin: West African Small Humpless Longhorn; imported from DRC and Guinea Conakry
Performance data reference: F20(1) -37 W50-11 FAO Breed Survey Direction de l'Elevage
Comments management conditions: On the state and properly managed private farms animals are fed on grazing and concentrates whereas on the poorer farms animals are fed on total grazing. Both state and poorer farms use natural water sources to supply drinking water for the animals.
Additional performance parameters: Animal weight is somewhat less in the villages.

Comments management conditions: Subsistence farming. Tethering is the main system carried out where animals are moved around regularly.
Subsistence farming. Tethering is the main system carried out where animals are moved around regularly.

Location within country: Low tropical zone, Andean Valleys, Atlantic coast and at the foot of the mountain llanero.
High tropics, located in the departments of Cundinamarca, Boyacá, Santanderes and Antioquia.

Description Of Specific Uses: The principal use of animals of this breed is meat production, which is improved by crossing with Zebu (Brahman) cows and for milk production Holstein crosses are used.
Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is adapted to the local environment of a medium coffee climate in the mountainous area of the Colombian Andes.
Specific resistance or tolerance: This breed is reported to be resistant to Dermatobia hominis (Nuche) and Brucelosis.
Specific reproductive characteristic: The animals are known for longevity and prolificacy.
Special characteristic of product: Animals of this breed produce lean and tender meat, and milk of excellent quality.
Other special qualities: Animals of this breed are highly appreciated for crossbreeding with Zebu (Brahman) and Holstein, to produce hybrids for meat and milk respectively.
Reference for special qualities: German Martinez C. PhD ICA- La Livertad- Villavicencio Gustavo Hernandez PhD ICA -Tibaitata- Bogota; Oscar Arboleda, PSc Universidas Nacional- Medellin
Color comments: uni coloured: white skin/fleece with black or reddish (pale) ears, the latter called Blanco Orejimono (White Pale Ear), BOM multi coloured: mixed black and white: blue white and with black markings mainly on the head, neck and flanks called blue-painted
Horn shape size and comments: medium sized horns with black tips
Other specific visible traits: Black and /or pale ears and dark skin for the former and pale for the latter are characteristics of the breed. Another visible characteristic is the pale or pink skin of new born animals, and their progressive pigmentation until two years of age.
Location within country: In the medium (coffee) zone between 800 and 1 800 m asl in the Colombian Andes, in the departments of Antioquia, Caldas, Risaralda, Quindio, Cauca, Valle del Cauca, Huila, Tolima and Cundinamarca.
Performance data reference: FAO Breed Survey Data forwarded from EAAP in 1991 Martinez, C.G. 1987. Estimation of genetic parameters of several productive traits in a Colombian cattle breed Blanco Orejinegro (BON) and its crosses with Zebu, Charolais and Santa Gertrudis. Ph. D. Thesis. Oklahoma State Univ., Stillwater, United States. Hernandez, B.G. 1981. Las razas Criollas Colombianas para la produccion de carne. Recursos geneticas animales en America Latina Ganado Criollo y especies de altura. FAO. Rome, 22-52.
Management conditions performance measur: Production data were measured under sedentary conditions, without housing and with permanent grazing.
Comments management conditions: The animals are usually grazing, and very rarely show animals and males in AI programmes are housed.

Description of origin: continually imported from North America; exotic
Location within country: Low tropical zone, Andean Valleys, Atlantic coast and at the foot of the mountain llanero.

Description Of Specific Uses: Its main use is in crosses with zebus (Brahman), but in this case the female is used with Brahman bulls and because of this the increase in numbers reported by the 1999 census may not be very reliable.
Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is very well adapted to the flooding plains of Colombian Oriniquia in the departments of Casanare and Arauca.
Color comments: uni coloured: tan multi coloured: sometimes spotted
Other specific visible traits: Creole type
Location within country: flooding savannahs in Casanare and Arauca, North-eastern Colombia
Comments management conditions: Casanareño livestock is kept under more extensive conditions than the rest of the criollo livestock.

Location within country: Altillanura zone, Llanos del Meta, Casanare, Arauca and Atlantic coast.

Description Of Specific Uses: Meat production is carried out by crossing Chino bulls with Zebu (Brahman) cows.
Adaptability to specific environment: It is very well adapted to the hot canyon/valley zone of the Santander departments and posess great heat resistance.
Specific reproductive characteristic: The animals are known for their high fertility.
Color comments: uni coloured: tan to chestnut
Other specific visible traits: similar to Horned Costeno
Description of origin: local Criollo variety with Zebu blood

Management conditions performance measur: Production data were measured under sedentary conditions, without housing and with permanent grazing.
Comments management conditions: Grazing with mineral supplement.

Description Of Specific Uses: Due to the scarcity of individuals, bulls in commercial enterprises have a double use, for mating with cows of different genetic composition but with predominantly zebu blood.
Adaptability to specific environment: Animals of this breed are adapted to the hot, arid savannahs of the north coast of Colombia

Description of origin: Llanos Orientales, Colombian Criollo cattle breed

Description of origin: The first Jersey were brought to Colombia in 1946 by Alfonso Lopez Pumarejo and taken to the Savannah of Bogota. The second group was brought in 1951 by the government, who placed the herd in governmentfarm in Armero, in order to cross with local breeds. In 1960, the Secretary of Agriculture of Tolima directly imported another group from the island of Jersey to increase the milkproduction the local cattle breeds.
Location within country: High tropics, located in the departments of Cundinamarca, Boyacá, Santanderes and Antioquia.

Description of origin: embryos imported from Europe (1984) and Canada (1988); exotic

Adaptability to specific environment: The animals are very well adapted to the conditions in the Valle del Cauca, Hacienda Lucerna (Tulua), its place of origin.
Specific reproductive characteristic: This breed is known for high fertility.
Color comments: uni coloured: red
Description of origin: composite of Holstein Friesian (40%), Milking Shorthorn (30%) and Criollo (Harton) 30%
Performance data reference: FAO Breed Survey Duran, C.V. (1976) Genetic and environmental parameters in the Lucerna herd of cattle in Colombia. M. Sc. Thesis, North Carolina State University, USA.
Management conditions performance measur: Production data were measured under sedentary conditions, without housing and with a diet based on pasture and sugar cane residues.

Location within country: High tropics, located in the departments of Cundinamarca, Boyacá, Santanderes and Antioquia.
High tropics, located in the departments of Cundinamarca, Boyacá, Santanderes and Antioquia.

Description Of Specific Uses: Its meat is very sought after because of its lean and excellent quality, both in pure bred animals and those crossed with Zebu (Brahman).
Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is reported to be heat tolerant and is adapted to flooded lowlands.
Specific resistance or tolerance: This breed is reported to be resistant to tick infestation.
Specific reproductive characteristic: This breed is known for high fertility (conception rate).
Special characteristic of product: Meat of this breed is sought after because its low fat content and tenderness compared with that from Angus cattle and for this reason Angus might be a possible ancestor of this breed.
Other special qualities: This breed is known for longevity.
Reference for special qualities: Hernandez, B.G. 1976. Genetic factors in beef cattle crosses in Colombia. Ph.D. Thesis. Colorado State University, USA
Color comments: multi coloured: red, yellow
Other specific visible traits: polled
Description of origin: The breed was formed by a mutation of Costeño con Cuernos and/or by crossing the latter with Red Angus and/or Red Polled, which is very improbable because the breed was known long before the introduction of the aforementioned British breeds. The name of the breed is derived from its lack of horns and from its place of origin - the Sinú river valley on the north coast of Colombia, department of Cordoba.
Location within country: Atlantic Coast, Valle del Sinu, Cordoba Province
Performance data reference: Data forwarded from EAAP in 1991 Hernandez, B.G. (1976) Genetic factors in beef cattle crosses in Colombia. Ph.D. Thesis. Colorado State University, USA. Hernandez, B.G. (198) Las razas criollas colombianas para la produccion de carne recursos geneticas animales en America Latina Ganado criollo y especies de altura. FAO, Rome, 22-52.
Management conditions performance measur: Production data were measured under sedentary conditions, without housing and with permanent grazing.
Comments management conditions: The dry season lasts about three to four months.

Description Of Specific Uses: Its main use is in crosses with zebu cows (Brahman).
Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is adapted to fibrous forages and high temperatures.

(1981) Las Razas criollas colombianas para la produccion de carne. Recursos geneticas animales en America Latina Ganado Criollo y especies de Altura. FAO, Rome, 22-52.

Color comments: multi coloured: magpie-black, black, magpie-red
Other specific visible traits: Characteristic well-developed hump in males, not well-developed in females. Muscles are well-developed. The head is small, with a rectilinear and often concave profile; small ears. Well-developed dewlap.
Description of origin: Madagascar, région de Mahajanga. The Malagasy zebu was introduced in Madagascar by the immigrants from Indonesia via the Indies, Arabia and Eastern Africa.

Description: "Česká červinka" means red cattle located in the Czech Republic
Other name: Bohemian Red, Czech Red, Česká Červinka, Czech Red
Regulation and Maintenance Uses: Vegetation management
Description Of Specific Uses: Mostly suckler cows, limited number kept as dairy
Additional information: 2003: The breed, especially for lack of breeding bulls, is classified as endangered.
Additional information comments: 2008: Except a herd kept at University farm for research and monitoring purposes (about 40 heads), kept in 10 small herds
Efabis cultural role comment: 2007: none
Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is well adapted to live under the natural conditions of Bohemia and Moravia.
Specific resistance or tolerance: The animals are of heavy constitution, hardy and healthy
Specific reproductive characteristic: good fertility and mothering ability
Special characteristic of product: 2007: used mostly as non-dairy (suckler cows), or else as subsistence dairy breed (milk, homemade butter, cheese)
Other special qualities: The breed is known for its longevity.
Efabis genetic features: marker/major genes: -alpha s1 casein B=0,964 C=0,036; -beta casein A=0,786 C=0,214; -kappa casein A=0,464 C=0,536; -Microsatelite IDVG A-Q H= 0,854; -Microsatelite CSSM 004 H= 0,582; (2001)
Efabis environmental role: 2007: used in extensive grazing systems within agri-environmental schemes
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: Adapted to extensive grazing systems in hilly/highland areas
Color comments: uni coloured: red, darker head and legs, tint udder
Horn shape size and comments: Short, narrow horns, light colour sometimes with black tips, with a tendency to turn downwards in later age
Other specific visible traits: medium body frame, dual-purpose (milk/meat) type
Description of origin: Successor of ancient European red cattle of the Bos brachyceros origin, formerly spread over Bohemia and middle Europe: in the beginning of the 20th century improved by Bern and Simentals bulls, after 1945 stepwise eliminated. Since 1987 a rescue program for the last remaining herd has been started, using semen of closely related Polish Red.
Import: 1987-1994, Polish Red (Poland) semen, 1998-2000 Rotes Höhenvieh (Germany)- two sires
Location within country: Middle and South of Bohemia, North-eastern Moravia
Management system: Back Yard or Farm Yard Production, Extensive (non back yard)
Management conditions performance measur: extensive summer grazing in highland area
Comments management conditions: This breed is well adapted to be raised on pasture (as sucklers). Breeding stock must be raised at zero concentrates (forage only) otherwise gets fleshy with problems in limbs development.
Additional performance parameters: 900g daily weight gain in suckler calves (2005) In 2011, during 150 days lactation the milk yield recorded in 5 cows between 680-1550 kg milk with 3,9% fat and 3,45% protein. Bulls fattened in common fattening unit by silage + concentrates reached 1250g/day.

Description: A part of the Cesky strakaty skot, remaining since 1990 uninfluenced by genes of similar breeds used later for improvement i.e. Simmental, Montbéliarde etc.

Description of origin: A part of the Czech Red-Pied cattle, remaining since 1990 uninfluenced by genes of similar red-pied breeds, held in-situ as conservation herd

Management system: Back Yard or Farm Yard Production, Extensive (non back yard), Intensive

Description: Red pied cattle of Simmental origin
Other name: Strakaty skot, Cervenostrakaty skot, Tschechische Fleckvieh, Simmental Cattle
Description Of Specific Uses: Dairy cattle, beef cattle
Additional information comments: Since 1955-1958 immigration of Ayrshire an Red Holstein genes has been realized for the improving of the milk production of the cows kept in large units. Nowadays European Fleckvieh genes are increasing.

Other special qualities: This breed is known for its health and adaptability.

Description of origin: composite of Czech Red, local strains and Simmental, since mid-19th century since 1995, continuous and increasing inflow of Montbéliarde and Fleckvieh of different origin makes this breed a composite population better characterized by a name "Red Pied cattle in Czech Republic". The remaining very small residue of "unimproved"animals not influenced by these foreign genes was in 2010 concentrated in the conservation nucleus bred separatedly under the name of "Czech Red Pied - original type"
Management conditions performance measur: Commercial herds

Description of origin: The breed has been imported from Sweden and the island Jersey. The first import took place in 1896. From 1896 to 1980 the Danish Jersey population expanded by pure breeding. Since 1980 some import of semen, mainly from USA, but also from New Zealand has taken place. The percentage of genes originating from the original Danish Jersey of 1980 has consequently decreased and it is now down to 74% (1997).
Import: since 1980 import of semen from Jersey bulls from USA and New Zealand
Management conditions performance measur: Milk parameters are the average yield of all milk recorded cows at 1. lactation in 305 days. Meat parameters have been measured on young bulls at performance test stations.
Comments management conditions: Danish Jersey is used in intensive dairy production. The majority of cows is housed in tie barns during winters. Heifers are raised in loose holdings and summer grazing. Male calves are mainly used for special veal production in intensive fattening units and slaughtered at approximately 220 kg liveweight at approximately 8 months of age.
