Efabis genetic features: According to the immunogenetic testing of animals of this breed there are such most common allele BGKQTI'P'B ", BQI'O ', BGKO', GOT2B" in its allele fund. Herd is characterized by medium level consolidation (Ca = 0.092)
Color comments: Colour varies from light golden-red to red-brown, around the eyes and nasal mirror hair is blond in the form of rings.
Other specific visible traits: The structure of the body is harmonious, with well-marked meat forms. The body is slightly stretched, strong feet and legs. Head is small, neck short. Chest is broad, but not deep. The back is wide, smooth, with well-developed muscles. Rump is long, slightly deflected. The rear part of the body is well developed, hips are well-filled. For the size of body Limousines yield only to Charolais.
Description of origin: Exotic. Created by improving of local Aquitaine cattle
Import: Imported from Hungary and earlier from the USA. In 1993, into the Main selection center 64 heifers and 4 bulls of Limousin breed were imported from Colorado (USA).
Location within country: Lviv, Odessa, Sumy, Chernihiv region of Ukraine
Additional performance parameters: Live weight of weaning calves is 240-300 kg. Bulls at the age of two and three years - respectively 790 and 855 kg.

Description: The name comes from the Piedmont region, where it was created.
Description Of Specific Uses: Used in industrial crossing. Progeny from cross of bulls of this breed with dams of Holstein and Black-and-White breeds have an average gain 1,2-1,3 kg, carcass yield - 60-63% and are born without problems.
Special characteristic of product: Calves give plenty of tender, lean meat, with good taste and low content of cholesterol.
Other special qualities: Calves have a thin skin and skeleton, grow well.
Other specific visible traits: Average size, broad body. A characteristic feature of the breed is "double сroupe" that provides the highest yield of meat. Animals have a maximum muscular development, especially the rear and front (at the withers) parts of body.
Description of origin: imported from Italy. Created in Italy by way of prolonged selection of grey steppe cattle for meat traits.
Import: In 1995-1996 pp. to the Main selection center 6 bull and 12 heifers were brought from Italy.
Comments management conditions: Animals do not require special feeding, good eat hay and grass.
Additional performance parameters: Live weight of heifers at 17-25 months ranged from 380 to 540 kg, bulls at 18-21 months - from 600 to 700 kg.

Description: Comes from the mountain valley Pintsgow in the province of Salzburg.
Adaptability to specific environment: Breed is well adapted to mountain conditions.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Average volume of ejaculate in 4-5-year-old - 4-5 ml, concentration - 1 -1.2 billion / mL, activity - 8-8,4 points, resistance to freezing - 88 - 95%, fertilization at the first insemination - 67-70%.
Other special qualities: Cattle of this breed belongs to double type of production
Efabis genetic features: Specificity of the gene pool of breed is marked by such alleles in the system of blood groups: BA'P'Q ', BGKE'F'G'O'G'', Q, O', BI1PE3'G'I'G'', OA'E3'F 'J'I'Q', GOTY, BGKB'O '
Color comments: Animals are of red colour with a broad white stripe on the back (belt), which runs along the belly from front to back
Efabis skin colour: Nasal mirror is brown or dark
Other specific visible traits: Animals of this breed have proportional structure of the body, sturdy skeleton. Head is of medium size, with moderately developed neck muscles, wither is low, moderately wide, back is straight, chest is deep, but often narrow. Sacrum is wide, udder is of medium size, roundish. Limbs are of medium size, strong, correctly placed, with strong hoofs.
Description of origin: Derived by reproductive crossing of Tuksunllertal strain of Tyrolean breed with the local red cattle
Import: Pintsgau cattle began to be imported to Bukovina (Transcarpathian region) in 1860, and the second time - in 1895
Location within country: Carpathian mountain areas, Chernivtsi and Ivano-Frankivsk region

Additional information: There are no more purebred animals of authentic Red Polish in Ukraine, they all are improved with other foreign breeds, primarily Holstein. Therefore, there is the question of renaming the array of animals, which are known as Red Polish into Western type of Ukrainian Red Dairy breed. Ukrainian Red Dairy breed was created at the related to Red Polish breed stock and improved by the same methods as Red Polish.
Adaptability to specific environment: Animals are well adapted to conditions of Polissya region of Ukraine
Specific resistance or tolerance: A general resistance has been reported.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Reproductive ability is within the physiological norm.
Special characteristic of product: Milk has good technological properties and is used as quality material for cheese production. Meat of terminal calves has high quality.
Other special qualities: Quickly responds by increasing of milk production at improving of feeding and management. Undemanding to feed.
Color comments: It has uniform colour with different shades - yellow-red, cherry-red, reddish-brown, brown.
Other specific visible traits: Animals belong to the dairy type of cattle with poor muscled body. Many of them have a number of significant exterior defects, such as narrow chest, poor rear part building, weak development of skeleton.
Description of origin: Created by a complex reproductive crossing of Polish local cattle with Angler and Danish Red breeds
Location within country: Volyn and Ternopol Regions, western Ukraine
Management conditions performance measur: Performance data were collected from animals kept under stationary conditions, housed for 7 months per year and fed on grazing, fodder and concentrates.

Description: Named after the location where this breed is bred and managed now, as well as for the direction of production.
Additional information: There are 6 lines and more than 30 families in the breed.
Additional information comments: Animals steadily transmit to progeny their productive, biological and exterior-constitutional peculiarities.
Specific resistance or tolerance: Youngsters are characterised by resistance to gastrointestinal and pulmonary diseases.
Specific reproductive characteristic: The animals are marked for good reproductive ability (85 - 90 calves per 100 females), and easy calving (4.5-5 points).
Other special qualities: The breed is moderately early-maturing (17-18 months).
Reference for special qualities: Kravtsiv, R.Y. Beef - valuable nutritional product and the state and perspectives of its production/ R.Y. Kravtsiv, G.M.Koval// Scientific herald of Lviv National Academy of Veterinary Medicine. - Vol.5. - Part 3. - P. 151-155.
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: They satisfactorily stand as low, so high temperature, that makes possible to keep them at open yards the whole year.
Color comments: Light shades
Other specific visible traits: Animals are long- and wide-bodied, with a small head and short neck, deep chest and well developed rear third part of body, have a relatively low limb.
Description of origin: It is resulted in complex reproductive crossbreeding of native Simmental, Grey Ukrainian and foreign Charolais, Chianina and Ingush breeds.
Location within country: The area of breed using covers 9 regions of Ukraine (23 breeding farms), except the south.
Additional performance parameters: Live weight of calves in 18 months - 510-530 kg, heifers at 18 months - 400-410 kg, the cost of feed per 1 kg of gain - 6.8 feed units.

Other name: Red Colonist, Red German, Chervona Stepova
Adaptability to specific environment: This breed is exceptionally good adapted to the continental dry hot climate of southern Ukraine.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Reproductive ability of Red Steppe cattle is good in normal conditions of feeding and management (in average 90 or more calves from 100 cows).
Other special qualities: Good reaction at improving of management and feeding conditions, high payment of feed by milk, which has a relatively low fat content and solids in milk. Animals are poorly accustomed to industrial technologies.
Efabis genetic features: Out of ten most common B allele blood groups animals of Red Steppe has four main ones - BOYD ', BO, BP', YY '.
Color comments: There are animals with white spots mainly on the udder, chest and head
Efabis skin colour: Nasal mirror is dark gray or marble.
Other specific visible traits: Dairy type conformation, relatively light-weight skeleton, a well-developed middle part of the body, moderately developed muscles. They have a compact and strong body.
Description of origin: composite of Red East Friesian, Angeln and Ukranian Grey, later also Swiss Brown and East Friesian.
Location within country: The Red Steppe breed natural habitat is the steppe areas of Ukraine.
Management conditions performance measur: Performance data were collected form animals kept under stationary conditions, housed for 5-6 months per year and fed on grazing, fodder and concentrates.
Additional performance parameters: There are 3 main zonal types: Zaporozhskij (high milk production), Crimean (combine high milk yields with high fat content) and Donetskij (high milk production with high live weight).

Description: The name comes from the river Simme in the valley which was derived this breed.
Additional information: Animals of this breed are characterized by strength of the constitution, the ability to consume large quantities of bulky food, good meat quality and high potential milk production.
Additional information comments: There are two types of animals in farms of Ukraine - milk-and-meat type and meat-and-milk type.
Adaptability to specific environment: Cattle is known for good adaptation properties.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Fertility of Simmental cows decreases with increasing of their productivity
Special characteristic of product: Meat is juicy, bright in color
Other special qualities: Animals of this breed are of double direction of production.
Efabis genetic features: For the animals of this breed typical is hemoglobin locus polymorphism - the frequency of hemoglobin in average is 0.18.
Color comments: Colour is light-brown. There are red-and-white animals, but all animals have white head and bottom of abdomen.
Other specific visible traits: Milk-and-meat animals are a bit high-legged with well-developed, deep and flattish chest. Wither is sharp. The middle part of the body is proportional with well marked "dairy triangle." Muscularity is satisfactory, strong and properly placed legs. Meat-and-milk animals are large as well and proportionally built. Their body is very deep and round with rounded and wide ribs. Stocky with well-developed musculature.
Description of origin: Simmentals of Ukraine has blood of Ukrainian Grey breed, as it was crossed with it at the very beginning of importation of Simmental into Ukraine.
Import: Firstly Simmental were brought into Unkraine at the beginning of XIX century to Chernigiv region.

Horn shape size and comments: There are two types in the breed: antlered and polled.
Description of origin: It is based on widespread in Ukraine Simmental cattle of double direction of productivity, using the cattle of foreign selection (poll Simmental of American and Austrian selection).
Location within country: The area of spreading includes seven regions of Ukraine
Management system: Back Yard or Farm Yard Production, Intensive, Semi Intensive
Additional performance parameters: The rate of fertility is 90-98%

Additional information: There are two innerbreed types: Tauride (high share of zebu blood) and Znamyansk.
Additional information comments: Cow live weight at 3-5 age is 437-532 kg. Young bulls reach live weight 480-530 kg at 16-18 months at daily gains 990-1020 g.
Adaptability to specific environment: Resistant to sudden changes of temperature
Specific resistance or tolerance: Resistant to mastitis, piroplasmosis, tuberculosis, leukosis, brucellosis.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Calves output per 100 cows is 85-97%. Easy calving and good maternal properties.
Other special qualities: Characterized by good fattening and meat traits.
Reference for special qualities: Guzev I.V., Chyrkova O.P. Breedcreating process in beef-breeding of Ukraine/Animal breeding and genetics. - Interinstitutional thematic scientific collection. - Vol. 44. - 2010. - P. 10-14.
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: Animals are well adapted to extreme conditions of the southern Ukraine. Animals of this breed have no sharp reaction at sun radiation and high air humidity.
Color comments: uni coloured: typically red or light grey
Other specific visible traits: Animals have good marked meat forms. Cattle has strong type of body, light skeleton and strong hoofs.
Description of origin: Resulted in complex reproductive crossing and hybridization of bulls of beef breeds (Aberdeen-Angus, Hereford, Charolais, Santa-Gertrude) and zebu animals at dams of Red Steppe breed
Location within country: Donetsk, Mykolayiv, Odesa, Kherson, Chernigiv region (southern and eastern regions)
Comments management conditions: The animals have relative simplicity to the conditions of feeding and housing. Breed is characterized by good use of pasture forage.
Additional performance parameters: The content of bones is 17.1%, the cost of feed per 1 kg of gain is 6,7-7,8 kg of oat feed units.

Description: The name comes from the canton Schwitz, where the breed was created
Additional information: The main breed resources are concentrated at the "Mikhaylivka" breeding farm, Sumy oblast (region).
Adaptability to specific environment: Characterized by high biological plasticity, so have good acclimatisation ability.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Fertilization at the first insemination - 68-72%.
Special characteristic of product: Milk is highly butter-suitable, due to relatively high number of fat balls in 1 ml of milk, their diameter and speed of churning. At production of hard cheese like Dutch from Swiss cows milk, one spent 0.7 kg less of raw milk than at the production of this cheese from milk of Lebedyn cows.
Efabis genetic features: Animals have high frequency (0,22) of ОТУ2 allele in system В blood group. Besides it, their characteristic feature is relatively high frequency BYG′P′Q′Y′G′′ allele.
Color comments: Of silver-brown colour, from silver-gray and light brown to dark brown shades. The most typical is greyish color with a light stripe along the spine. When growing older, the color of animals become lighter.
Other specific visible traits: Constitution of Swiss breed animals is strong and dense. Animals have a harmonious body shape with strong not rough bones, well-developed muscles, elastic skin. Head is narrow in the nasal part and wide in frontal, neck is shortish with well developed musculature and dewlap, chest is broad and deep; limbs are properly set. Udder is large, well shaped, medium size, with a cylindrical teats.
Description of origin: exotic; imported. This breed was bred in Switzerland by purebred selection.
Import: First time Swiss breed entered Ukraine in 1960-1965, mainly from Austria. During this period were imported 443 heifers and 93 bulls to Kharkiv and Transcarpathian regions. From 1977 till 1984 to Ukraine were imported 13 bulls from USA, Canada and Austrian to Sumy, Chernigiv and Transcarpathian breeding joint ventures. Deeply frozen semen of valuable foreign bulls was widely used as well. In 1993-1994 to “Bezdrik” breeding plant of Sumy region was imported 176 Swiss heifers from Germany.
Location within country: Sumy, Transcarpathian, partly Chernihiv and Kharkiv regions.

Description: The name refers to the country, where this breed was bred and the direction of production.
Additional information: In the breed there were approved 7 lines, 42 families and two types: Lokhvytsky-Zolotonoshskiy and Holovenkivskyy.
Additional information comments: Animals are massive with good developed forms.
Adaptability to specific environment: High acclimatization ability of animals
Specific reproductive characteristic: The cows are characterized by good maternal properties, good reproductive traits (85 - 90 calves per 100 cows). Calving runs easy usually, without complications. The share of heavy calvings is 2.9%. They have no postnatal diseases.
Other special qualities: Young bulls reach live weight 600 kg at 18 months at daily gains 1500 g. Food consumption to get 1 kg of gain constitute 6.0-7.7 feed units.
Reference for special qualities: Guzev I.V., Chyrkova O.P. Breedcreating process in beef-breeding of Ukraine/Animal breeding and genetics. - Interinstitutional thematic scientific collection. - Vol. 44. - 2010. - P. 10-14.
Other specific visible traits: Distinctive exterior features of this breed are proportional body composition, strong, dense type of constitution, rather developed, deep (81 cm) and wide (61 cm) chest. Animals are very tall (height at withers bulls - 150 cm, cows - 130 cm), with smooth line of top and sufficient length of body, well developed rear third of body, rather strong skeleton. Animals are massive and compact.
Description of origin: The Ukrainian Beef breed was resulted in complex reproductive crossbreeding of females of local Gray Ukrainian and Simmental breeds with bulls of French Charolais and Italian Kian.
Location within country: Animals are bred in majority of climatic zones of Ukraine (southern-eastern region: Dnipropetrovsk region; central region: Poltava, Chernigiv region; Sumy region).
Management system: Back Yard or Farm Yard Production, Intensive, Semi Intensive
Comments management conditions: Good pasture use.
Additional performance parameters: Live weight of calves at weaning at 6 months is 200 - 220 kg. In the 18 months of age they reach the live weight 565 kg, with average daily gain 1208 g at cost of feed per 1 kg of gain 6.8 HP units.

Other name: Ukrayinska chorno-ryaba molochna, Ukrainian black spotted
Additional information: Today's type of the Black-and-White cattle has been formed up in Ukraine, for number and structure over 40. In the breed there were selected three innerbreed types, which differs in maternal basis and share of Holstein blood: Central-eastern, Western and Polissian. Central-eastern type - 65-70 % of cattle of this breed in number. years. The number of cattle has grown more than eight times over that period of time.
Specific resistance or tolerance: Animals of the breed do not yield on resistance to the source breeds and to other breeds of the relevant area
Specific reproductive characteristic: Уоung bulls for the ejaculate volume, sperm concentration, activity and fertilizing ability do not yield to the source breeds.
Reference for special qualities: Breeding resources of Ukraine/ Under the scientific edition of M.V.Zubets, V.P.Burkat. - K: "Agrarian science", 1998. - 336 p.
Efabis genetic features: High frequency of A, C, E, F, L, H′ antigens (more than 50 %) and low frequency (less than 10 %) of R1, M, U′, H′′ factors is typical for the animals of new breed. For antigens A, C, X1, U′ this breed is like to Holstein, for factors E, X2, V, L the animals are close to Holland breed. Specific for this breed are such factors as R2 (its frequency is 44% versus 14,2 of Holstein and 12,2 - of Holland breeds), W (less, then Holstein and Holland breeds have). The most specific for this breed are factors U і H′′. For alleles of B-system blood group the biggest share have BOY, BOYD′ і OJ′K′O′, that shows its clear differentiation compare with source breeds.
Other specific visible traits: Animals of Central-eastern innerbreed type have solid, dense constitution, cup-shaped udder, a long neck with a thin folded skin, sharp wither, back is wide and flat, long, strong limbs, well-developed middle part of the body. For the structure of body type animals of Western innerbreed type are close to animals of Central-eastern type. Animals of Polissian type have mainly combined type.
Description of origin: Resulted in crossing of black-and-white cattle of native selection with Holstein bulls.
Location within country: Raised in all regions of Ukraine and Crimea
Management system: Back Yard or Farm Yard Production, Intensive, Semi Intensive
Additional performance parameters: Animals of Western innerbreed type in productivity by 10-15% yield to the animals of Central-eastern type.

Description: The name derives from the colour of animals and type of production
Additional information: It is recommended to breed the animals of the breed in the farms of Sumy, Kharkiv, Chernihiv and Transcarpathian regions and used as breeding material for improving of brown breeds.
Adaptability to specific environment: The animals are characterized by good acclimatization ability
Specific resistance or tolerance: Characterized by resistance to diseases
Specific reproductive characteristic: Characterized by good reproductive ability.
Special characteristic of product: Increased milk fat and protein, especially kappa-casein fractions, that provides its high cheese-suitability.
Other special qualities: High suitability for machine milking technology, higher at 1-1.5 lactation average length of commercial use
Efabis main colour: Different shades of brown (from light to dark)
Other specific visible traits: Animals are characterized by large size, strong constitution, dairy type of body.
Description of origin: Created by crossing of Lebedyn and Swiss of Western European and North American selection cattle and later breeding of improved cattle of desired type "in itself".
Comments management conditions: Animals fits to different systems of management

Description: indigenous
Description Of Specific Uses: Used for crossbreeding with beef cattle. Cattle of Grey Ukrainian has qualitative skin, which is used as high-qualitative material.
Additional information: Grey Ukrainian belongs to the local, endangered breeds of Ukraine.
Additional information comments: Grey Ukrainian bull youngsters' raw hides at 12 months' age weighted 33.4±2.25 kg and were treated as heavy hides. Raw hides' output-to-finish weight ratio was 10.21 %. Length of raw hide was 208±4.5 cm.
Efabis cultural role comment: indigenous breed, which is typical for ancient image of Ukraine and is associated with ancient (beginning of the farming) times.
Adaptability to specific environment: Adapted to the steppe conditions.
Specific resistance or tolerance: The breed is noted for resistance to a number of diseases (epizootiсs).
Specific reproductive characteristic: Characterized by small size of fetus, high rate of fertility. Output of calves per 100 cows for many years is at the level of 90-99%.
Special characteristic of product: The milk has a high butterfat content.
Other special qualities: Animals of this breed are hardy animals with low nutritional requirements and good viability.
Efabis genetic features: The animals of the breed are bearers of rare genes. This breed should exist at least as a potential source of genetic material that can be used in the future. Recent studies of blood and milk discovered unusual genetic combination in the genotype, such as specific alleles of system B blood group, rare hereditary units of milk casein alleles. In erythrocytes one found variant of protein - fosfohlyukomutaza, in plasma - a new protein - posttransferyn 3. Breed is marked by high saturation of antigenic factors because of the large number of multi-allele and a high frequency of factor V. Coefficient of homozygosis on alleles of a blood group B is 0.68, which indicates the stock of genetic variability. Specific for breed are alleles: BGKQYB'FE'GI'O ', BI1QTI', BP1QA'D ', O1'A'D'G', OB'E2'K'P'Y '. Medium content of aberant cells was 37.9-48.1 %, what is higher, than other breeds' animals have.
Color comments: Colour is gray or light gray, often with dark shade at neck, chest, belly. Calves born are of burnt orange colour.
Efabis skin colour: Nasal mirror is of dark colour. Gained dark pigmentation of the skin. Hooves, horns end, tassel tail - of dark color.
Horn shape size and comments: The horns are long, wide apart, lyra-liked, with black ends. At some cases distance between horn tips reached 213 cm. Length of horns sometimes was reported 61-92 cm.
Other specific visible traits: Animals are tall and leggy, have proportional strong structure, high correctly posed legs, have well-developed front part of body and thick skin. Skin is dense, animals are tall and large with stretched body. Wither is high, muscles are well-developed. Udder is mainly of rounded and bowl-liked form.
Description of origin: Native breed of Ukraine, one of the oldest breeds in the world.
Location within country: Bred in Donetsk, Kyiv, Sumy, Kherson and Dnipropetrovsk regions.
Management system: Back Yard or Farm Yard Production, Intensive, Semi Intensive
Management conditions performance measur: Performance data were collected from animals kept under stationary conditions, housed for 5-6 months per year and fed on grazing, fodder and concentrates.
Additional performance parameters: In the 16 months age bulls achieved weight 420-480 kg, spent 7.8 oat feed units per 1 kg of gain.

Additional information: Cows are characterized by high milk production with high content of fat and other nutrients in milk and satisfactory (as for high productive cattle) reproductive ability.
Adaptability to specific environment: High adaptation and acclimatization properties
Specific resistance or tolerance: For resistance cattle of new breed does not yield to the maternal (Red Steppe) and parental (Angler, Red Danish, Holstein) breeds. In same conditions of feeding and management animals of new breed do not differ significantly from Red Steppe on resistance to leukemia and mastitis.
Efabis genetic features: Frequency of B-allele variant of cappa-casein is 0.240.
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: Recommended for breeding in extreme hot climate zones of south and east of Ukraine
Color comments: Colour of animals is mainly red, crimson, cherry, some animals of Holstained type - red and red-and-white.
Other specific visible traits: The animals of the breed have changes in proportions of body structure to the direction of higher front part of body, relative narrower chest and a substantial reduction of narrow buttock compare with other breeds.
Description of origin: This breed was created in farms of Southern and Eastern Ukraine at dams of Red Steppe breed by means of reproductive crossbreeding with use of Angler, Red Danish and Red-and-White Holstein bulls.
Location within country: South, east and center of Ukraine
Management system: Back Yard or Farm Yard Production, Intensive, Semi Intensive

Description: The name comes from the direction of production, colour and country, where it is bred
Other name: Ukrayinska chervono-ryaba molochna, Ukrainian Red spotted
Additional information: The breed has a precise, clear and sufficient genealogy structure for pure breeding: three interbreed types, five breeding farm types, 12 breeding farm lines and 46 high productive families. There are three innerbreed types in the breed (Central, Southwestern and Carpathian) and six plant types (Vinnitskij, Kyivskij, Prylukskij, Kharkivskij, Cherkasskij and Bukovinskij).
Specific reproductive characteristic: Bulls for reproductive ability (ejaculate volume, sperm concentration, mobility and fertilizing ability of sperm) do not significantly differ from the Simmental.
Efabis genetic features: Frequency of B-allele variant of cappa-casein (CSN3) in milk is 0.250. Frequency of L-allele of growth hormone gene, which correlates with milk fat is 0.715. On BLG frequency of A-allele was 0.165, B-allele - 0.835.
Other specific visible traits: Strong dense constitution, harmonic structure of the body. Head is elongated, neck is narrow, long, with folded thin skin. Blades fit tightly to the body, wither is sharp. Back is flat, wide, long, with a slight inclination of it to the buttock hills, muscled enough. Limbs are strong, with dry and well-developed joints, middle third of the body is well developed and deep with a characteristic milk triangle, ribs set obliquely, chest is deep and relatively wide.
Description of origin: Created at the result of reproductive crossing of Simmental breed with Red-and-White Holsteins. In some areas additionally used Montbeliard and Ayrshire cattle.
Location within country: The area of breed raising covers 19 regions (oblast) of Ukraine and Crimea.
Management system: Back Yard or Farm Yard Production, Intensive, Semi Intensive
Additional performance parameters: Live weight of heifers at 12 months - 300-320 kg, at 18 months - 400-450 kg.

Color comments: comments: black, red, brown or grey with white

Description: The name comes from colour and habitat of animals of this breed. Created at the end of XVIII-beginning of XIX c.
Regulation and Maintenance Uses: Fertilizer, Habitat provision and biodiversity, Weed control and biomass residue management
Cultural Uses: Dressage, Fancy, Research, Tourist attraction / touristic potential
Production environment/management system: Mainly extensive, though can be used in intensive.
Literature related to uses and ecosystem: Gene pool of farm animals of Ukraine: tutorial/ Baranovskii, D.I., Herasimov, V.I., Nagayevych, V.M., Hohlov, A.M. and others/ Under the edition of HSIHA prof. Baranovskii, D.I. and Herasimov, V.I. Harkiv: Espada, 2005. - 400 p.
Additional information: It yields to other breeds in productivity, especially to Black-and-White. That's why array of breed sharply decreased. It is a local endangered breed of Ukraine, which needs saving.
Additional information comments: Hoof horn is dense.
Efabis cultural role comment: It is ancient native breed of Ukraine.
Adaptability to specific environment: Well adapted to local conditions of Polissya region (western part of Ukraine).
Specific resistance or tolerance: Animals are resistant against leucosis, tubercolosis and brucellosis.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Volume of ejaculate of bulls of 4-5-years old - 4,3-5,0 ml, sperm concentration - 1,02-1,06 billion / mL, activity - 8,1-8,5 points, resistance - 21 -25 th., resistance to freezing - 87-91%, fertilization at the first insemination - 68-72%.
Other special qualities: These animals are reported to have a high feed-conversion efficiency.
Reference for special qualities: Yefimenko, M.Ya. The state of Whiteheaded Ukrainian conservation at modern stage/ M.Ya.Efimenko, M.G.Porhun, M.Y.Chehivskiy, A.V.Boyarska, V.M.Bulka//Interdisciplinary thematic scientific digest "Animal Breeding and Genetics". - Vol.42. - K.: Agrarian Science. - P. 82-87.
Efabis genetic features: Typical for animals of this breed is high proportion of alleles in the B system of blood groups: BGKTE'O ', OTYK'Y', YA ', O, OA'.
Color comments: The animals of the breed are white headed black with white accents on the chest, belly and legs, white head is with dark circles around the eyes.
Other specific visible traits: Animals are of tender, thick constitution with a light head, long neck, very deep chest and long backward, well-developed middle third of body, strong low legs.
Description of origin: Composite of Groningen Whiteheaded of different strains and Ukrainian Grey.
Performance data reference: Gene pool of farm animals of Ukraine: tutorial/ Baranovskii, D.I., Herasimov, V.I., Nagayevych, V.M., Hohlov, A.M. and others/ Under the edition of HSIHA prof. Baranovskii, D.I. and Herasimov, V.I. Harkiv: Espada, 2005. - 400 p.
Management conditions performance measur: Performance data were collected from animals kept under stationary conditions, housed for 5.5 months per year and fed on grazing, fodder and concentrates.
Comments management conditions: Nutritionally undemanding.
Additional performance parameters: Live weight of youngsters at age 6 and 12 months for heifers is respectively 140 and 235 kg, for bulls - 160 and 306 kg.

Description: Named after the region where this breed was created. This breed have being created over 20 years (1974-1994). The second beef cattle breed, which was created in Ukraine.
Description Of Specific Uses: Bulls are used in the industrial crossing with dairy breeds, providing increased meat production crosses by 8,1-10,1%.
Additional information: Breed includes 6 lines and 24 families. Animals steadily transfer to progeny biological, exterior-constitutional features and productive traits (high energy growth, slaughter traits and meat quality)
Additional information comments: Intensive use of pastures contributes to high outcome of calves - 81.0 %.
Adaptability to specific environment: Adapt to climatic zones of the Western region.
Specific resistance or tolerance: Cattle resistant to infectious diseases (leukemia, brucellosis and tuberculosis).
Specific reproductive characteristic: The cows have good motherly properties.The high reproductive abiliity and ease calvings. Calving runs usually easy, without complications, practically there are no difficult ones.
Special characteristic of product: Excellent meat quality.
Other special qualities: Excellent meat quality. Young bulls of Volynian Beef breed are characterized by a unique ability to gain lean beef with high ratio of protein and fat in the flesh of carcasses 1,9:1 even when they reach the final live weight 590-600 kg at 18 months.
Reference for special qualities: The program of selection of Volynian Beef cattle breed for the period 2003-2012/ Yanko T.S., Zubets M.V., Burkat V.P., Vdovychenko Yu. V., Podoba B.Ye. et al. - K.: Agrarna nauka, 2003. - 79 p.
Efabis environmental role: Enclosure-pasturing grazing system used for keeping of animals of this breed on pasture enhances pasture productivity by 25-30%, prolongates the use of herbage. Animals use crop residues and crops of "green belt".
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: They tolerate cold, heat. They are characterized by efficient use of pasture, coarse and succulent feeds.
Color comments: Red colour from light to dark red with white marks on the head.
Other specific visible traits: Animals have strong constitution. They have proportional body composition, wide and rounded, slightly elongated body, well developed muscles. Chest is wide and deep. Back is straight, wide, well-developed muscularity.
Description of origin: Native breed, created in Volyn at the Near Carpathian and Polissian conditions by means of reproductive crossbreeding of local Black-and-White and Red Polish breeds (maternal basis) with bulls of Aberdeen - Angus, Hereford, Limousine breeds.
Location within country: Vinnytsia, Volyn, Kyiv, Lviv, Rivne regions of Ukraine (39 farms, including 14 breeding).
Management system: Back Yard or Farm Yard Production, Intensive, Semi Intensive
Comments management conditions: Dams are managed in winter at loose housing system at deep bedding in buildings of light type with free access to farm feeding yards. Terminal young bulls are managed in stalls (bound), using cheap rough, succulent feeds, including concentrates up to 20% in ratio structure; in summer - grazing, except terminal young bulls, without concentrates feeding. Calves till 6-8-months are managed at suckling.
Additional performance parameters: Live weight of calves at weaning at 6 months - 180 - 220 kg. Calves aged 15-18 months reach a live weight of 472-592 kg. The cost of feed per 1 kg of gain - 6,2-8 feed units.

Additional information: 2004, this breed is in critical condition (467 head, 4 bulls).
Adaptability to specific environment: well adapted to pasturing.

Description of origin: Variety of Criollo with bulldog snout, partially dominant; The first descriptions of this variety were provided by Feliz de Azara at the end of the 18th century. Darwin located a few specimen in the Northern part of the Rio de la Plata (now Uruguay) in 1833. At his request, he received information from Dr. Muñiz who contributed with biological data to his studies on the evolution of the species. Further studies by Domingo F. Sarmiento in 1885 and, more recently, by Corquera in 1982, conclude with the extinction of this variety. Due to Dr. Wilkins (British Mission in Bolivia) doubts, investigations were initiated in north western Argentina (Province of Jujuy), where a few specimen of Ñato cattle were located and a breeding unit for characterization was initiated.

Description of origin: imported; Crosbreeds of cattle brought by the early settlers.
Comments management conditions: Of the 100 largest cattle farms in Vanuatu 74% are privately owned, companies own 17 % and 9% are community owned. Herd sizes vary greatly from the very large plantations to small holders with only a few cattle. The 2002 cattle census showed that 41% of the farms in Vanuatu had less than five animals with 93% of farms having less than 50 animals. Only four farms had more than 5,000 animals. All cattle are fed almost exclusively on pasture, either improved or native, with some use of bush or forest areas in times of drought. Some tree legumes are being utilised as food for cattle

Description: Short-horned Zebu cattle found predominately in the Eastern part of Zambia and extends to the northern boarder with Tanzania and Malawi and also in Mozambique.

High milkers are able to give about 50 litres of milk per day (milking twice). There are also crossbreeds of Holstein-Friesians with the indigenous breeds that have been produced over the years found in the smallholder dairy farms.

Description: Bantu tribes who moved down the continent and crossed the Zambezi about 700AD took with them their cattle. In the 16TH century, Portuguese explorers reported the presence of cattle in present day Zimbabwe, and the first White settlers found large numbers of an estimated 500,000 cattle in the hands of the local inhabitants. These were distributed along the central plateau, which was a Tsetse fly free zone, and were almost exclusively of the SANGA type. Characteristically, they: - were neck-humped - had a small stature - were rounded in appearance with sloping rumps - had sleek and shiny coats - were fine bone structured - had small, broad and alert heads - had long, thin active tails - had horns in cows which curved outwards and forwards, and were round and fine in cross-section - had horns in bulls which were also rounded but shorter and heavier, curving out and upwards - had horns in oxen which were longer and more widespread - were predominantly black in colour, followed by reds and browns, with yellows and duns being less common - had coat colours were often accompanied by white patches or stipples very broken in outline - frequently had black and red colour mixing giving rise to variations of attractive M’Sundu pattern or more rarely brindle (Nhuru)
Other name: Amanjanja, Makaranga, Ngombe Dza Vakaranga, Shona, Ngombe Dza Maswina
Provision Uses: Dam line, Draught power, Fuel (manure), General crossbreeding, Meat, Production of offspring for slaughter as young animals, Saving security, Skin/hides, Transport
Regulation and Maintenance Uses: Fertilizer, Fire protection, Habitat provision and biodiversity, Land degradation and erosion prevention, Vegetation management
Cultural Uses: Dressage, Cultural and religious ceremonies, Research

Specific reproductive characteristic: high fertility
Other special qualities: This breed is known for a good survivability.
